tool_description: Baseball MLB Data about players, teams, reports, and other stats.
name: MLB Data
title: MLB Data

api_list.name: Projected Hitting Stats
api_list.description: Retrieve a players projected hitting stats for a given season.  Omitting the season parameter will return the actual stats for the players earliest major league season.

api_list.name: Season Pitching Stats
api_list.description: Retrieve a players pitching stats for a given season.

required_parameters.name: game_type
required_parameters.description: Example: 'R' The type of games you want career stats for.  'R' - Regular Season  'S' - Spring Training  'E' - Exhibition  'A' - All Star Game  'D' - Division Series  'F' - First Round (Wild Card)  'L' - League Championship  'W' - World Series

api_list.name: Broadcast Info
api_list.description: Retrieve information on broadcasts over a given period.  start_date and end_date parameters should be in the YYYYMMDD format.  Although you can omit the home_away parameter to retrieve both home and away game data, one will include the other. For example, a New York Mets home game result will include data for the visiting team.

optional_parameters.name: home_away
optional_parameters.description: Example: 'H' ‘H’ for home games, ‘A’ for away games. Omit for both.

optional_parameters.name: sort_by
optional_parameters.description: Example: 'game_time_et_asc' Field to sort results by.

api_list.name: Career Hitting Stats
api_list.description: Retrieve a players career hitting stats for a given game type.

required_parameters.name: game_type
required_parameters.description: Example: 'R' The type of games you want career stats for.  'R' - Regular Season  'S' - Spring Training  'E' - Exhibition  'A' - All Star Game  'D' - Division Series  'F' - First Round (Wild Card)  'L' - League Championship  'W' - World Series

api_list.name: League Hitting Stats
api_list.description: Retrieve a players career hitting stats for a given game type split by the league.

required_parameters.name: game_type
required_parameters.description: Example: 'R' The type of games you want career stats for.  'R' - Regular Season  'S' - Spring Training  'E' - Exhibition  'A' - All Star Game  'D' - Division Series  'F' - First Round (Wild Card)  'L' - League Championship  'W' - World Series

api_list.name: Get Roster by Seasons
api_list.description: Retrieve a teams roster between a given start and end season.

optional_parameters.name: all_star_sw
optional_parameters.description: Example: 'N' Set to ‘Y’ for all star data, and ‘N’ for regular season.

optional_parameters.name: sort_order
optional_parameters.description: Example: name_asc Field to sort results by.

api_list.name: League Pitching Stats
api_list.description: Retrieve a players career hitting stats for a given game type, split by league.

required_parameters.name: game_type
required_parameters.description: Example: 'R' The type of games you want career stats for.  'R' - Regular Season  'S' - Spring Training  'E' - Exhibition  'A' - All Star Game  'D' - Division Series  'F' - First Round (Wild Card)  'L' - League Championship  'W' - World Series

api_list.name: Get Teams by Season
api_list.description: Retrieve a list of major league teams that were active during a given season.  If all_star_sw is set to 'Y', you will instead receive data on the all star teams for that season.  You can sort using the sort_order paramater. Ex: Sort in ascending order by the name field using sort_by='name_asc'

optional_parameters.name: all_star_sw
optional_parameters.description: Example: 'N' Set to ‘Y’ for all star data, and ‘N’ for regular season.

optional_parameters.name: sort_order
optional_parameters.description: Example: name_asc Field to sort results by.

api_list.name: Career Pitching Stats
api_list.description: Retrieve a players career hitting stats for a given game type.

required_parameters.name: game_type
required_parameters.description: Example: 'R' The type of games you want career stats for.  'R' - Regular Season  'S' - Spring Training  'E' - Exhibition  'A' - All Star Game  'D' - Division Series  'F' - First Round (Wild Card)  'L' - League Championship  'W' - World Series

api_list.name: Player Teams
api_list.description: Retrieve the teams a player has played for over the course of a season, or their career.

api_list.name: Player Search
api_list.description: Search for active and historic/inactive players by name.  The active_sw parameter should be set depending on whether you want to search for active or inactive players. You can omit this parameter, though you will notice a slower response time as the search is done across all (active and inactive) players.

required_parameters.name: name_part
required_parameters.description: Example: 'cespedes%25' The player name to search for.

optional_parameters.name: active_sw
optional_parameters.description: Example: 'Y' Set to ‘Y’ to search active players, and ‘N’ to search inactive/historic players.

api_list.name: Pitching Leaders
api_list.description: Retrieve n leaders for a given hitting statistic.  This endpoint is best used alongside col_in/col_ex to prune response data. Without, it returns entire player objects.  For best results, include the player’s name, id, and the stat as a starting point.  See: Using col_in & col_ex

required_parameters.name: results
required_parameters.description: Example: 5 The number of results to return.

required_parameters.name: sort_column
required_parameters.description: Example: 'era' The statistic you want leaders for.

required_parameters.name: game_type
required_parameters.description: Example: 'R' The type of games you want career stats for.  'R' - Regular Season  'S' - Spring Training  'E' - Exhibition  'A' - All Star Game  'D' - Division Series  'F' - First Round (Wild Card)  'L' - League Championship  'W' - World Series

api_list.name: Injuries
api_list.description: Retrieve all players which are currently injured.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://mlb-data.p.rapidapi.com/fantasylookup/json/json/named.wsfb_news_injury.bam"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "mlb-data.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://mlb-data.p.rapidapi.com/fantasylookup/json/json/named.wsfb_news_injury.bam"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "mlb-data.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Transactions Over Period
api_list.description: Retrieve all transactions between a given period. start_date and end_date parameters should be in the YYYYMMDD format.

required_parameters.name: end_date
required_parameters.description: Example: '20171231' End date of time period.

required_parameters.name: start_date
required_parameters.description: Example: '20171201' Start date of time period.

api_list.name: Get 40-Man Roster
api_list.description: Retrieve a team’s 40 man roster.

api_list.name: Hitting Leaders
api_list.description: Retrieve n leaders for a given hitting statistic.  This endpoint is best used alongside col_in/col_ex to prune response data. Without, it returns entire player objects.  For best results, include the player’s name, id, and the stat as a starting point.  See: Using col_in & col_ex

required_parameters.name: game_type
required_parameters.description: Example: 'R' The type of games you want career stats for.  'R' - Regular Season  'S' - Spring Training  'E' - Exhibition  'A' - All Star Game  'D' - Division Series  'F' - First Round (Wild Card)  'L' - League Championship  'W' - World Series

required_parameters.name: results
required_parameters.description: Example: 5 The number of results to return.

required_parameters.name: sort_column
required_parameters.description: Example: 'ab' The statistic you want leaders for.

api_list.name: Game Type Info
api_list.description: Retrieve a list of one or numerous game types.  For example, if you wanted to know when the National League Championship Series was played, this endpoint could tell you that.

required_parameters.name: game_type
required_parameters.description: Example: 'L' 'R' - Regular Season  'S' - Spring Training  'E' - Exhibition  'A' - All Star Game  'D' - Division Series  'F' - First Round (Wild Card)  'L' - League Championship  'W' - World Series

api_list.name: Projected Pitching Stats
api_list.description: Retrieve a players projected pitching stats for a given season.  Omitting the season parameter will return the actual stats for the players earliest major league season.

api_list.name: Season Hitting Stats
api_list.description: Retrieve a players hitting stats for a given season.

required_parameters.name: game_type
required_parameters.description: Example: 'R'. The type of games you want career stats for.  'R' - Regular Season  'S' - Spring Training  'E' - Exhibition  'A' - All Star Game  'D' - Division Series  'F' - First Round (Wild Card)  'L' - League Championship  'W' - World Series

api_list.name: Player Info
api_list.description: Retrieve general information on a player. This includes name variants, education information, country of origin and attributes like height, weight and age.
